intro: Cherleria bisulca, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive ribbed or grooved appearance. Cherleria bisulca is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
